title: Fundamental Applied Rheology | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: This course focuses on a combination of theory, case studies, and hands-on activities that enable learners to better apply rheology fundamentals to their daily applications.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
This course focuses on a combination of theory, case studies, and hands-on activities that enable learners to better apply rheology fundamentals to their daily applications.

The application of rheological concepts in materials is increasingly important as industries and researchers alike seek to understand their products more deeply. By doing so, they are able to develop more effective and efficient products and processes.
Determine material functionality in product development
Evaluate texture by correlation to sensory data
Assess intermediate or final product quality control
Perform process engineering calculations involving equipment such as pumps, pipelines, extruders, rollers
This course will equip participants with the basic competencies:
To identify rheological properties of materials
To identify the test methods and geometries of the rheometer
To describe various rheological behaviour using common constitutive models
To recognise how rheology can be applied in product development and testing
A combination of theory, case studies and hands-on activities will enable participants to better apply the fundamentals of rheology to their daily applications.

Rheology is a characterisation tool that relates to products that are liquid, paste and soft solids and is therefore applicable across all industries. Nonetheless, typical ITMs that are involved in the development and production of these materials, particularly food manufacturing, energy & chemicals and healthcare, would be relevant.
This course will be suitable for practitioners who have started or intend to use rheometers in the following fields:
Sales and marketing of technical products
Part I: Terminologies and basic concepts:
Define concepts of stress, strain and strain rate (time)
Define concepts of solid, semi-solid and liquid
Identify the main equipment used to measure rheological properties of solid and fluid

Identify stress-strain and stress-strain rate relationships for different materials, including an understanding of the terms of elastic modulus, yield stress, strain hardening, breaking stress and strain, viscosity, shear thinning and shear thickening, storage and loss moduli, tan d
Part II: Rheometer – test geometries and test methods
Rotational flow tests and related constitutive models
Fitting of data to constitutive models using a spreadsheet
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Aaron Goh has a primary interest in the structure-property-function relationships of materials. He holds a BEng and a Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering from Imperial College London and his work experience includes being a Material Scientist at Unilever R&D. His achievements include the Research Fellowship from the Royal Commission of 1851 Exhibition as well as a Young Scientist Award from the American Association of Cereal Chemists International Rheology Division.
Associate Professor, Massey University, New Zealand
Associate Professor, Massey University, New Zealand

Associate Professor Kelvin Goh is the Massey University Programme Director of SIT-Massey Food Technology degree program in Singapore.  He has been an academic staff member at Massey University’s School of Food & Advanced Technology in New Zealand for about 25 years.  He has published over 70 papers in international peer-reviewed journals.  His research interests include characterisation and functionality of food ingredients; physicochemical properties of starch and non-starch polysaccharide systems; protein-polysaccharide interactions, and structuring of foods for improved functionality and nutrition.
Lead Professional Officer, Singapore Institute of Technology
Lead Professional Officer, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Danping obtained her B.Sc in Applied Chemistry from Xi’an Jiaotong University and Ph.D in Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering from the National University of Singapore. She is currently working as a senior professional officer at SIT. Her research interest includes –
nanocatalyst and thin films fabrication for energy and environmental applications, physical and chemical characterization techniques including elemental, FTIR spectroscopy and electron microscopy studies of material composition and structure.
A Certificate of Participation will be issued to participants who:
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
The full fee for this course is S$1,744.00.
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.

Towards Food Innovation, One Small Batch at a Time

Jointly launched by SIT, Enterprise Singapore and JTC in April 2022, FoodPlant, Singapore’s first shared facility for small-batch food production, has garnered interest from various food manufacturing players. One of them is SGProtein, a Singapore-based meat analogue manufacturer, who has partnered SIT and FoodPlant since 2021 through a series of student projects, Continuing Education & Training (CET) courses and manufacturing collaborations.
In a world shaped by constant disruption, lifelong learning is pivotal in nurturing innovative and adaptive workers, enhancing economic competitiveness and quality of life.
Explore the fundamentals of fire engineering science and its role in analysing fire behaviour, heat transfer, and fluid dynamics in complex built environments.
Graduate Certificate in Fire Dynamics and Fire Modelling
District Cooling Systems: Technologies, Components, and Sustainable Engineering
Learn the fundamentals of district cooling systems, including technologies, engineering principles, and sustainability strategies, to optimise efficiency and minimise environmental impact.
Sustainability, Energy Efficiency, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering
CHE6031N01 Process Safety Management and KPIs
Learn about effective Process Safety Management systems and associated performance measurement to ensure safe plant operations.
Graduate Certificate in Process Safety Management and Engineering Design
Next-Generation Food Innovation: Texture Development and Advanced Rheology
Learn theory in mechanics, rheology and biopolymer chemistry. Gain hands-on experience in extrusion basics and texturing a formulation using high-moisture or low-moisture extrusion.
CHE6031N02 Permit to Work for Management
This course delves into the operations and compliance measures of the Permit to Work (PTW) system, enhancing control over high-risk tasks and ensuring workplace safety.
Graduate Certificate in Process Safety Management and Engineering Design
This course covers RAM theory and its application across industries to assess system performance and efficiency, thereby enhancing system availability.
Graduate Certificate in Process Safety Management and Engineering Design

Jointly launched by SIT, Enterprise Singapore and JTC in April 2022, FoodPlant, Singapore’s first shared facility for small-batch food production, has garnered interest from various food manufacturing players. One of them is SGProtein, a Singapore-based meat analogue manufacturer, who has partnered SIT and FoodPlant since 2021 through a series of student projects, Continuing Education & Training (CET) courses and manufacturing collaborations.
In a world shaped by constant disruption, lifelong learning is pivotal in nurturing innovative and adaptive workers, enhancing economic competitiveness and quality of life.
Explore the fundamentals of fire engineering science and its role in analysing fire behaviour, heat transfer, and fluid dynamics in complex built environments.
Learn the fundamentals of district cooling systems, including technologies, engineering principles, and sustainability strategies, to optimise efficiency and minimise environmental impact.
Learn about effective Process Safety Management systems and associated performance measurement to ensure safe plant operations.
Learn theory in mechanics, rheology and biopolymer chemistry. Gain hands-on experience in extrusion basics and texturing a formulation using high-moisture or low-moisture extrusion.
This course delves into the operations and compliance measures of the Permit to Work (PTW) system, enhancing control over high-risk tasks and ensuring workplace safety.
This course covers RAM theory and its application across industries to assess system performance and efficiency, thereby enhancing system availability.
